intro: Rabdochloa spicata, commonly known as the spikeless grass, is a perennial plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typically clustered at the tips of the stems. Rabdochloa spicata is often found in moist, well-drained soils in temperate regions. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of conditions.
